main_definition: The act of reducing the size or volume of something, usually through pressure or a process that eliminates redundancies.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A reduction in volume or space
meanings_and_examples.example: Data compression reduces the file size on your computer.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act of compressing clothing items to save space
meanings_and_examples.example: I need to do my laundry and then I'll have to compress all my clothes into the suitcase.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An increase in pressure applied to an object or substance
meanings_and_examples.example: The tire was under compression due to overinflation.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A medical term referring to a muscle strain caused by excessive stretching
meanings_and_examples.example: He suffered from compressions in his calf after running the marathon without proper training.
